meanings.definition: Enzymes that cleave nucleotides from the end of a polynucleotide chain.
meanings.sent1: The exonucleases removed the extra nucleotides from the DNA chain.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use exonucleases to study the structure of DNA molecules.
meanings.sent3: The exonucleases were like tiny molecular scissors trimming the genetic material.
meanings.sent4: Her precision in editing the document was compared to the action of exonucleases on DNA.
meanings.sent5: The exonucleases acted like molecular pruners, snipping away at the genetic sequence.

meanings.definition: Proteins that hydrolyze nucleotides from the end of a nucleic acid molecule.
meanings.sent1: Researchers discovered new types of exonucleases in the cell.
meanings.sent2: Exonucleases play a crucial role in DNA replication.
meanings.sent3: The exonucleases in the lab were jokingly called 'molecular munchers'.
meanings.sent4: The exonucleases worked tirelessly, breaking down the nucleic acid chain.
meanings.sent5: The activity of exonucleases resembled a tiny molecular cleanup crew, tidying up the genetic material.
